intro: Tontelea multiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered tontelea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its clusters of small, white, tubular flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a glossy surface, while its stems are woody and branched. Tontelea multiflora is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
